name: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine
Reason: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that impact its melting point. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The methoxybenzoyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The naphthoyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +30°C. The hydrazono-thiadiazole conjugated system introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point by about +70°C. The carbonyl group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, estimated at around +40°C.
